intro: Zauschneria pringlei, commonly known as the Sierra primrose, is a flowering plant native to California and southern Oregon. It belongs to the genus Zauschneria in the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive flowers and often succulent stems. The species is characterized by its showy, showy yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in rocky or open habitats, often in sunny areas with well-drained soil. Zauschneria pringlei is a perennial plant that is well adapted to the dry, Mediterranean climate of its native range.
